fields.description:
For authentication over ssh access is denied. It states that the access is denied for 'password' I used not the 'username' entered. Perhaps the input in the password field is used as both username and password, since entering the inputs in the reverse order doesn't work either.

This is a critical bug since i displays the password in plain text. 

This functionality works in version 0.9.4.0 on my colleagues computer (HP Laptop).
fields.summary: SSH Authentication Fails

fields.description:
I'm seeing some very strange behavior when I switch branches while using the "Current Branch" filter. Right now I'm trying out the hg flow to research how we want to use branching when we convert from SVN to Hg.

I noticed that as I switch from the 'develop' branch to 'default' and back, I actually was seeing the log of the other branch. So I added a couple new branches, and noticed that the actual behavior is that the log shows me whatever branch that had previously been my active branch.  If I select all branches then current branch, it will show the correct one.

I was running 1.0.8 in Windows; I updated to 1.1 and still have the same issue.
fields.summary: Using "Current Branch" filter doesn't show correct branch (Hg)
SourceTree crashed when I was reviewing a commit

fields.description: The diff section of the application will show all text as ASCII when a file is encoded in UTF-8 without BOM.  The way I confirmed that it was ASCII was by switching to ASCII mode inside Notepad++ and I got an identical set of garbled text.  I attached images of one instance of this in the diff view, and in Notepad++.  Furthermore, UTF-8 without BOM shows a miscellaneous character as the first character of the document.  Adding a BOM caused the application to detect the file correctly, however using BOM with UTF-8 is not recommended by the Unicode standard (section 2.6).
fields.summary: Diff doesn't detect UTF-8 without BOM

fields.description: main.cpp has utf-8 encoding without BOM
fields.summary: Encoding problem in internal diff

fields.description: At the bottom of the diff tab in the options menu there are instructions for the using custom external diff program. The $PWD argument is missing in these instructions, which is needed in order of the command to work.
fields.summary: External Diff: Custom's instructions lacking the $PWD argument

fields.description:
Creating a new feature using GITFLOW, it's natural to try and create a feature (for example) with spaces.

Fix For Broken Ethernet Support

Sourcetree hapilly accepts this, and then GIT rejects it.   It would be really nice if you didn't get that far to have obscure and unfriendly GIT messages thrown back as a result of this rookie mistake.

If illegal characters are entered, the user should be notified and not allowed to create the GitFlow feature.

Guessing there are other places in the client where the also a problem.
fields.summary: Using GitFlow, New Feature, branch name is not validated for illegal characters.

fields.description:
It is very common (read: practically the only way I ever pull) for me to have to do the following with git, as illustrated by terminal commands:

1) git stash
2) git fetch
3) git rebase
4) git stash pop

The SourceTree UI already allows for having steps 2 & 3 merged into one logical operation, but it still means that I have to click the stash button, do a pull, then expand the stash tree, right-click, apply stash, select "delete after applying", and click the button.

It would be SO convenient if there was an option to automatically stash before the pull and pop the last stash after a pull so that I could just pull with one click (or the really handy keyboard shortcut!).

I can envisage this being implemented as another checkbox on the Git options tab, eg "Automatically stash changes before pull & reapply after successful rebase"
fields.summary: Option to stash before pull with merge and pop last stash immediately after
il brouser separato
browse

fields.description:
i have option [Current Branch] selected and then try to switch/checkout another branch. After that in the history tree i still see new branch's history line along with previous branch's history line.

To clear this, i need to select [All branches] then reselect [Current branch]. Now the history is for new branch.
fields.summary: [Current Branch] option still show multiple branches in Log/History panel

fields.description: I can easily open a terminal window to the root of a project, but I don't see an easy way to open an Explorer window to the same location. A button or keyboard shortcut for that would be excellent.
fields.summary: Add toolbar button to explore the root of a project

fields.description:
Lets say you add 3 libraries to the project, each containing 100+files.

If you want to add them to git repo as separate commits, you have to: 
select libraries files manually -> stage them -> commit -> repeat for next lib.

Its quite easy to select necessary files by clicking 1st file, then SHIFT + click last file. 

The problem is when you select a lot of files. Since SourceTree shows changes off all files in right side panel automatically, it locks down application for as much as a few minutes, until all previews are generated.

It would be great if SourceTree would how show previews for e.g. only 3-10 first files, then stops and adds simple button to load them all when needed.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Do not load changeset previews, when many files are selected.

fields.description:
I've got 27 repos and one of them seems to have developed a recurring problem.

My problem is that the error doesn't tell me which repo has the problem - before I can start with whats actually wrong.


Seems a little similar to SRCTREEWIN-146 .
fields.summary: generic 'Summary' failed with code 128: fatal: unable to read tree

fields.description:
Sorry to insist, as I reported this bug in question (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-915). But I could not make it work.
I am attaching all the needed screenshot and more a video that demonstrates the process and not sending tags to the server.

-----------------------------------

Excuse my lack of knowledge, but as demonstrated in the video below, I'm not getting cause a deleted tag in my local Git is also deleted in remote Git.
http://l.bitcasa.com/QWNbP3Mk
I also found this question in the session doubts: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/54483/how-to-delete-a-tag-and-push
but it helped me solve my problem.

-----------------------------------
When deleting a tag I do push (with the "push all tags" checked) apparently the wipe command is not being sent because when performing pull the tag returns from the server.

(Google Translate)
fields.summary: Can not delete a tag

fields.description:
It seems like changing the source url for a submodule is conceptually broken.  Part of it is how git handles submodules (via a file), and part of it is how we're doing forks.  When I fork my project, I typically fork 4 repos, a main one and 3 submodules.  When I change the submodule source url to the forked one it marks the .gitmodule file as modified; which is fine for my local repo but shouldn't be pushed in that way.

There should be an easier way, perhaps set it up as a remote?
fields.summary: Improve support for submodules

fields.description:
After valid installation the following error message is shown:
"C:\Program Files\Atlassian\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe is not a valid Win32 application".
fields.summary: ST4Win fails to start

fields.description:
The following error pops up (multiple times) after deleting a Git repo from SourceTree:

bq. 'Summary' failed with code 128: fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git

Some files of the repo are not deleted and remain on disk (in the .git folder).

Repro:
1. Right click on a Git repo in the left pane showing all repositories
2. Select "Delete" from the context menu
3. Click "Delete Repositories on Disk" in the "Confirm Remove" dialog

Expected:
No error message at all, repo should be entirely deleted.
fields.summary: Summary failed error when deleting a Git repo

fields.description:
It was a bit of a quick crash, so I'm only guessing that it's related to my ctrl+A immediately before? I haven't been able to reproduce since unfortunately. 

Here's the log report -

2013-08-19T16:17:48: Fatal error: 
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Specified argument was out of the range of valid values.

fields.summary: Crash after doing "select all" keyboard shortcut on unstaged files

fields.description: Please create a tool such that branches can have a changeable category or status, this would be extremely helpful for marking branches as 'On Hold', 'Feature Request Sent', 'Important', or any other string that would clue in the developer on which status each of his/her branches are in. I am looking at this as a local only option (not touching the remote) as this isn't something within git itself as far as I know. Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Categorize branches

fields.description: Launch the application to a repo page (or make a modification outside the application that causes a reload of the working set) and attempt to drag and drop a file before the "busy" mouse icon disappears.  I am getting this error consistently.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop Exception

fields.description:
This is a must have feature!

I'm constantly using another tool to write my commit messages before pasting them into SourceTree. If you'd add a Spell Checker in SourceTree then I could write my commit messages directly in SourceTree.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add a Spell Checker for the Commit Message text input.

fields.description:
We have had problems with data disappearing in git rebases when there is a conflict.

We tested this by changing the same line in a file on two different machines, and resolving the ensuing merge conflict when rebasing by selecting "resolve using mine". What actually happened is that we ended up with their version, not my version. The log in git showed only the "their" commit, the "my" commit was gone.

Marked as Critical since this results in data loss.
fields.summary: "Resolve using mine" resolves using their version of file.

fields.description: In the stashes window when there are alot of files in a stash it can be difficult to find a small change that I want to bring back rather than the entire stash. It would be nice to see the stash list the files in similar fashion to the main view.
fields.summary: In stashes window, show files, not just diffs

fields.description: In the diff window, selecting lines then having to scroll to find the discard can be problematic in longer file changes. Please provide an option to do this via a context menu.
fields.summary: Diff window should have a context menu that allows discarding selected lines

fields.description:
It would be nice to provide keyboard shortcut accelerators (underlined letters) on the context menus e.g. the working file list.
This would help repetitive tasks on non-contiguous files (e.g. discard some but not all files)
fields.summary: Keyboard accelerators on context menu(s)

fields.description: It would be nice to not have to click through sub menu to launch external merge tool - just seems tedious.  If the merge options were on the main screen, like near the 'External Diff' button, this would be so much faster.  Love the tool guys!
fields.summary: Click Path to External Merge Tool too Long

fields.description:
This is perhaps a duplicate of SRCTREE-1384.

When doing a Pull there is a checkbox for 'Commit merged changes immediatly.

The Mac version remembers the last state of the check. If I uncheck then the next time I do a pull it remains unchecked (which is good). The windows version has it checked every time I do a pull, even if I had unchecked it previously.

Whether or not it's a preference I don't really care but it would be nice to remember the state somehow.
fields.summary: Windows version doesn't remember checkbox state for commit merge immediately like mac version does

fields.description: Please allow for "Select All" or "Select None" when selecting the files to be committed.
fields.summary: Select All / Select None when Commiting

fields.description:
If a domain is used with bitbucket (for me it was git.example.org) and you want to connect to the own servers git it does not resolve correctly.

Example.org
git -> CNAME bitbucket.org
* -> IP
www -> IP

If you use the following domain: ssh://user@example.org/path/git.git
It does not resolve to example.orgs IP. With ssh://user@www.example.org/path/git.git it does.

More info: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/199990/connect-sourcetree-and-own-server
fields.summary: Correct DNS Resolving

fields.description: From a quick peek into the log it seems this function is not yet implemented.
fields.summary: Creating a tag in a mercurial repo results in an error

fields.description: It would be good to be able to have an on the fly search box which is displayed at the top of the tree on the repository view, this could then filter all sections, tags, branches and make life alot easier from a user perspective.
fields.summary: Search box

fields.description: When I click on Clone / New, enter my details for 'Add Working Copy' and then click 'Add', the data I entered into 'Name:' doesn't get saved. It defaults back to the name of the folder for the working copy.
fields.summary: Bookmark name doesn't get applied when adding a new bookmark

fields.description: I tried to drag an untracked file from SourceTree to Skype. Then ST crashed.
fields.summary: Crash during drag of untracked file

fields.description: After some commits to push to my origin, after a click on the Push button, the window appears blank and an error screen appears informing SourceTree has crashed
fields.summary: SourceTree crash on push command

fields.description:
When deleting a tag I do push (with the "push all tags" checked) apparently the wipe command is not being sent because when performing pull the tag returns from the server.

(Google Translate)
fields.summary: Can not delete a tag

fields.description: I am using version 1.0.8 on a Windows 7 system, when I double click on the line between graph and description, the graph gets very small (Picture 1), then if I double click again, the graph comes back to the size that it should, but it is over the description text (picture 2).
fields.summary: Graph column does not resize appropriately

fields.description: It would be quite useful to be able to have the ability to view the source / starting commit of a branch, as currently it can be quite difficult to sift through the graph & commits to find it.
fields.summary: View source commit of branch - starting point

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to have a scrollbar that can be brought up or enabled for the list of files, as currently its hard to get to see the full file paths etc.s
fields.summary: List of files when selecting a commit - scrollbar
update-index --assume-unchanged is not honored

fields.description:
In the commit tree of the log/history tab, the tags are truncated when containing a parenthesis.

Ex:
'test(1000)' is displayed in the commit tree as 'test'

The tag is well displayed on the left side of SourceTree (File status, branches, tags, remotes)
fields.summary: Tag with parenthesis is truncated in the commit tree

fields.description:
SourceTree seems not to save the path for external merge tool (KDiff3 in my case). I need to select it every time I restart SourceTree.

NOTE: I didn't install KDiff using official package, just pointed SourceTree to use the executable that comes with TortoiseHg.

Problem seems not to take place if one installs KDiff3 from the official package.
fields.summary: External merge tool path is not saved

fields.description: Assuming that the arbitrary URL is actually an appropriate repository (git for git, hg for hg), it should be possible to pull from an arbitrary location to bring in changes.  Imagine that you are the project custodian, in order to pull in changes from developers you need to configure each of their repositories as a remote.  It would make more sense if I could just plug in their read only repository URL and rebase from there.
fields.summary: Allow pulling from arbitrary URLs

fields.description: I committed some changes to my develop branch created using HgFlow and then went to switch to my feature branch and it said the SourceTree crashed and to submit a bug.
fields.summary: Crash when changing from develop branch to feature branch

fields.description:
SourceTree will convert a whole file from CR-LF (win) to LF (linux) if you use the "Discard Selected Lines" function for a CR-LF file on Windows.

Reproduce:
- Under Windows, create an ANSI file with CR-LF ending and check it into your repository.
- Modify a single line (or multiple lines) inside an external editor (notepad++).
- Select some lines of this file inside SourceTree and chose "Discard selected Lines"

Result:
- The whole file will be converted to LF and for this marked as 100% modified.
fields.summary: Undesired conversion of line endings (CR-LF to LF)

fields.description:
clicked somewhere in the repo list and it broke.

Surely the app could submit the log info to an API? I wonder how many users bother going to this much trouble?
fields.summary: Fatal crash

fields.description: In the repository view, I collapsed the origin remote tree branch, then the parent Remotes tree branch, and then the app crashed.
fields.summary: Crash on Remotes tree collapse

fields.description: When using the mouse, there is no short-cut to hide/show bookmarks other then going by the menu
fields.summary: Visual Icon for show/hide Bookwark

fields.description:
When viewing diffs in the commit dialog, I see that a tab is defined as 8 'space' characters.
I'd like to change this to be 4 'space' characters in width.

Unfortunately, I have no opportunity to change this value.
fields.summary: Allow user to change tab width for internal diff view

fields.description: Can you please add all branches to the branch selector in the full log window. I want to be able to see all commits from one branch. If you have a lot of branches the colors and knots are very confusing.
fields.summary: Select any branch in full log screen

fields.description:
It's basically what the Git client "Git Extensions" offers when selecting a commit and opening the "File Tree" tab (at the bottom). It allows you to see the original content (not diff) of all files of the currently selected/highlighted commit.

I believe that's a major functionality loss and would be really helpful to easily and quickly get an overview of the WHOLE repository at a certain commit without having to cherry pick it.
fields.summary: View all repository files (File Tree) of a selected commit

fields.description:
Sofar you get a warning when "creating" a detached head which is fine. 

I would like to propose an extra warning when switching from your recent commits that are apparently on no branch to a different one. Could be something like: 
You are leaving a detached head the following ..... commit will not be accessible after that. 
Thus leaving a detached head branch is not that easy for new users. :-)
fields.summary: Warning when leaving a detached head "branch"

fields.description: For me it gets a bit messy and confusing being able to select a repository from the repository explorer but still have a completely unrelated repository showing in the main pane. What would be more useful/intuitive would be to make the view on the right hand static and show the view relating to the currently selected repository.
fields.summary: Have only one active repository tab which is context sensitive

fields.description:
In the Repository settings, Advanced tab - The Use global user settings checkbox is checked by default. The information is filling in correctly, from the SourceTree for Windows Options > Default tab > Default user information. However in the Commit Graph view, the Author column shows unknown for name, and a bizarre email address that seems to consist of the Windows user @ computer name.

If I uncheck the User global user settings checkbox and retype the information, exactly as it existed before, and save it, the Commits show the name and email correctly.

It appears the default override for Global user settings isn't overriding the repository settings.

Another developer who sits next door to me, has similar behavior in SourceTree for Windows, except the email address is always correct, but sometime it shows his first and last name and sometimes it shows first letter of first name and lastname.

Desired functionality would be the Full Name and Email from the global user settings would consistently override all Git repo settings in SourceTree for Windows.
fields.summary: Global User Settings Not Overriding Repository Settings

fields.description:
Yesterday I added a Bitbucket repository, and now I cannot open Sourcetree anymore. The crashdump is 282Mb so a bit large to add beforehand.
In the screenshot you can see 'JaarverslaggevingApp_2', which is the Bitbucket repository.
The crash immediatly happens when startng, so Sourctree is unusable at the moment.
(But after removing the corresponding lines from 'bookmark.xml' it is working again).

BTW: if I try to add it again by using 'open', it cannot be done because 'open' only accepts git repositories.
fields.summary: Crash when starting SourceTree, seems to have to do with Bitbucket repository

fields.description: I'm running Windows 8.1 preview. However, I've been running SourceTree on this OS for more than a month, and this is the first time it's crashed.
fields.summary: SourceTree crash

fields.description:
First let me say what a great tool SourceTree is.  I use it daily.

I have a project that I need to run from an Ubuntu based VM.  I have created a samba share so that I can get at the files on my windows workstation.

Unfortunately, even though git on the Ubuntu machine tells me that tells me that all the files are on SorceTree (or git on Windows) is telling me that the files have been modified because the mode has changed from 755 to 644.  It says 'Modified File Mode 100755 -> 100644'.

Is this a SourceTree problem, a git problem or a Ubuntu Samba problem.  Is there any way that I can tell SourceTree to ignore the file mode?

Chris
fields.summary: Modified file mode when accessing source over a samba share

fields.description: Could you please mark version 0.9.5 as released?
fields.summary: Close version 0.9.5

fields.description:
I have quite a lot of repositories/bookmarks within my repository list in Sourcetree.

A "Quicksearch" filter within bookmarks would allow easier search for repositories within a lenghty repository list.
fields.summary: Quick search for bookmarked repositories

fields.description:
Having a lengthy list of repositories (bookmarks) within Sourcetree and a lot of branches within each repository, it's not easy to see on which branch of which repository I'm currently looking.

For sure there are some indicators, which allow to gain this information (selected tag indicates current repository, tiny check-icon and text in lower left corner of gui indicates current branch, but each time I look at the GUI - I have to search for those indicators. In my eyes they are not noticeable enough.

Therefore I would have some suggestion, to make them more ostentative:
* Give the in active tab a slightly different color (lighter grey?) - and make the title-text of the active tab bold or slightly larger ...
* Within the list of sourcetree-known repositories (i.e. the repository list shown on the left side of the GUI/bookmarks) there is already support for selection boxes: When you select a repository within this list, it's drawn within a blue / grey selection box. In my eyes it would be helpful to draw the active repository persitently within a different coloured box (green for example) - or choose a different text style (italic), size (slightly larger?) ... or... or ...
* Make the active branch within the branch list (left side of file status tab) more prominent (Surronding green box? Different font attributes (size, color, style?)?, different coloured branch or tag icon? ...)

I think this makes Sourcetree more ergonomic: you start "reading" on the left side: you can easily identify the active repository (if it would be recognizable within the bookmarks) - then you can easily identify the branch you are currently on (you already can do it now - but it's not noticeable enough in my eyes ...). At the moment you have to "jump around" with your eyes to gather the required information
fields.summary: Better highlighting of current repository/current branch

fields.description:
So I launched SourceTree for Windows this morning and the UI appeared relatively quickly, however, it has been spinning trying to open my repository for the last 30 minutes.

I have three repositories bookmarked here but all show the gray refresh icon. The single open repository has a spinner in the branches area, and the log says it is "Loading..."

Granted this is a slow HDD on this machine, but 30 minutes without any indication as to what is going on is somewhat annoying.

I can see 6 git processes in the background that are taking up some disk usage (around 0.5mb/s each) which is probably saturating the disk, but it would be very useful to:
1) Know what it is actually doing during this load.
2) Allow some prioritisation in the tasks (i.e. the bookmarked repositories I don't need loaded anytime soon - just the one that is already open).
fields.summary: Very slow SourceTree startup with no visibility as to the case

fields.description: Cloning bitbucket repo does not work: "This is not a valid source path/URL"
fields.summary: Cannot clone repo from bitbucket

fields.description: After a merge that affects a submodule, the submodule is left in its pre-merge state and marked as an uncommitted change. Running git submodule update --init from the CLI updates the submodule(s), resolving the uncommitted changes.
fields.summary: Git merge does not run submodule update --init

fields.description: This would help a lot. Or GitFlow should respect the global option "Push to default remote/origin when commiting"
fields.summary: GitFlow actions should all have a push option and a global setting for it

fields.description:
When starting something new with the GitFlow feature you do not have the ability to push automatically. You have to do this manual after you created something new.
If you forget to do that and you have no commits in the new release for example and you finish the release, the is an option to push right away, and you have selected to delete the release branch too, then the action fails/does not completely run through, because the remote does not have the release branch.
After this failed the dialog comes up again but the local branch is now deleted and nothing happens any more.
The problem is that the process did not complete, you merged the release branch into master but the master is not merged back to develop. If you didn't do any changes since the release branch then the develop is one commit behind the master and this should not be.
fields.summary: GitFlow 'Start New ...' does/cannot push

fields.description: Ordering in Working Copy Changes gets lost on each refresh caused by external changes in tracked folders or files
fields.summary: Ordering in Working Copy Changes gets lost

fields.description:
On the Log/History tab, I adjusted the splitter of the commit graph to give less screen real estate to it.  In addition, I adjusted the Description grid column width.

When I close and re-open the application, or switch to a different repository tab and then switch back, the changes I made are lost.

Expected behavior is that changes to UI elements (like splitters or grid column sizing) would be automatically persisted and apply per user (or per repository).
fields.summary: Changes to certain UI elements don't appear to be persisted

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Right click on left panel on bookmark's tab (I'm not sure how it's named) as shown on screenshot 1.
2) Select one of the context menu items.
3) New dialog shown (screenshot 2).
4) Press Esc or click Cancel on that dialog
5) Again right click on left panel on bookmark's tab  as shown on screenshot 3.
6) Context menu is disabled

But when we change focus to another bookmark tab or bookmarks list whatever, and go back to the bookmark's tab, then context menu is enabled again.
fields.summary: When call context menu on bookmark's tab left panel second time (after escaping previous menu item selection), context menu is disabled

fields.description:
As requested here (see conversation): http://twitter.com/sLoPPydrive/status/362477627291860992

Basically user wants to be able to pull across a merge commit into another branch, which requires the --mainline option to pick a parent to compare to. The user must be able to pick one parent commit of the merge (remember octopus merges) to use this option.
fields.summary: Add support for --mainline in cherry pick

fields.description:
The MSI packages downloaded by the updater are stored into the roaming profile of the current user under Windows, i.e. {{C:\Users%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\Atlassian}} under Windows 7.

Those packages are quite big and cause serious impact when working with roaming profiles, either increased logoff times while the profile is synced or no sync at all when the profile already hit its quota.

Please move those files into either the local profile ({{C:\Users%USERNAME%\AppData\Local\Atlassian}}) or, even better, make them temporary files that don't bloat the roaming profile and additionally get cleaned up after a successful installation.
fields.summary: Do Not Store MSI Packages In the Roaming Profile

fields.description:
Hi,

I Will like a way to list ALL Files of a repo, and Open It on a simple double click with to application associated to the extension.  Maybe in another tab at the bottom OR in the File Status windows with a flag where i can "show" unmodified file.

Il will be a fast way to edit file without having to switch to my windows explorer.
fields.summary: File List

fields.description: Software crashes as soon as I open it, no warning no detail just a screen full or error reporting boxes. Crash dump is too big to attach but log file has been attached.
fields.summary: Crashes as soon as I open it

fields.description:
Hello,
I'm using polish programmers keyboard and I cannot enter some polish characters in Commit message dialog. It's caused probably by some hard coded shortcuts that are interfering.

Following shortcuts/letters are blocked:
ć - Ctrl + Alt + c
ł - Ctrl + Alt + l
ó - Ctrl + Alt + o

Regards
fields.summary: Cannot enter polish characters in Commit message dialog

fields.description:
It would be nice, if there would be an "edit"-action available within the context menu for files (editor should be configurable)

Use case: Preparing a commit within "File Status" view.
During review process whilst preparing a commit of certain files I review the changes in those files before adding them to the staging area. Often I notice some small things to change (for example incrementing the version number) before I can commit. It would be nice to be able to open those files directly from sourcetree within an external editor. At the moment I have to browse to this file using explorer ("Huh? Where is the file?" ;-)) and open an editor from there ....
fields.summary: "Open With" on context menu

fields.description:
Here is a workflow that we have run into a lot and we are trying to solve it elegantly so we know what to do every time. 

We will be in the middle of a feature branch using git flow and we will find a bad bug and fix it. This bug is fixed amid a bunch of re-factoring and such. It would be nice at that point to finish up the feature and then push it out as a hot fix. That way the bug fix it is not hard to push out immediately and only the code in the feature related to the bug fix goes into the master branch. 

I know this isnt the default strategy for git flow but if there was an easy way to move items from a branch to a hot fix that would be nice.
fields.summary: Finish Feature as Hot-Fix

fields.description:
The text in Log/History grid view is white.
On my Other computer the text color is correct but on my laptop, I don't why, it is white.
I don't use special theme or every else.
fields.summary: The text in Log/ History grid view is white

As a user

to sort open tabs manually

fields.description:
Sourcetree crashes when I attempt to add a tag either to an existing commit, or to the working copy.

Steps:
1. Select "Tag" from top toolbar
2. Enter a tag name
3. Click "Add Tag"

I tried variations on the tag name (alphabetic, alphanumeric, special characters), attempted to apply a tag to an existing commit, unchecked 'Push tag', checked "Local Tag" under "Advanced Options". Same result each time.

Other:
Tagging works using mercurial from the command prompt, outside of Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Win8 - Hg:

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to quickly see wich branch are Tracked vs Those who are local.

You can do something alone :

develop = origin 
test
prod = origin

Or any other indicator ;)
fields.summary: UI display Local Branch vs Track Branch

fields.description:
When adding a submodule it is not possible to type a local relative path with spaces.
But you are able to browse for a folder and take one with spaces or create a new one with spaces in the "Select Destination Path" dialog, which pops up upon browsing, and select it after.

Adding runs fine, just a "cosmetic bug".
fields.summary: "Local Relative Path" box in "Add Submodule" dialog does not allow spaces

fields.description: Would be nice to have a choice in the bookmarks.xml so that we could point it to a central spot so that all the people in our team would have it.  I would be good if you can choose lists of bookmarks locations really.  I like to sync my laptop to my desktop.  The folder locations of the repos are the same for both so they are a mirror ad I can now already just copy the bookmark.xml from one to the other, but if I could keep it in a central location, I can skip the copy paste stuff and both will sync up. I have quickly made a mockup of the display to help make it clear how I mean it can works and would be great for us that switch machines a lot. can't imagine it being to hard of a request.  Cheers  -Jeremy Bass
fields.summary: choose bookmark location

fields.description: just went away. log included below.
fields.summary: Unexpected crash when pushing tag

fields.description:
SourceTree windows UI is not legible if windows desktop settings are set to use dark window background color with light colored font. Seems like some elements in UI were set to use system colors and others are fixed color, can the UI background, foreground and font colors be set to use windows system colors or all of them be fixed so that UI is legible in all cases?.

Attached screenshots should illustrate the issue.
fields.summary: Compatibility with dark developmer themes

fields.description: It would be extremely helpful to have this button in the Git Flow commands list. It would use the already existing "feature publish" command in git flow to send your current release to the server, so others can see your work (and, if desired, work on it too).
fields.summary: Feature Publish button in Git Flow commands

fields.description: When trying to create a new hg repo with hg support disabled, the option is not greyed, and the error message provided is unclear (the message is something like 'please see the error above' with just 'hg init ...' above)
fields.summary: Error message unclear when trying to create new hg repo

fields.description:
If you initialize hg flow from the terminal in a project, hg-flow functionality in SourceTree is broken. See attached screen.

There are differences in the .hgflow files.

When initialized within SourceTree:
[branchname]
master = default
develop = develop
feature = feature/
release = release/
hotfix = hotfix/
support = support/

When initialized within the terminal:
[Basic]
publish = default
develop = develop
feature = feature/
release = release/
hotfix = hotfix/
version_tag =
fields.summary: Sourcetree loses hg-flow init

fields.description:
When using the embedded version of HG within the terminal, it is not possible to use pull/ push to ssh repositories. HG gives the following error:

remote: 'ssh' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
remote: operable program or batch file.

This is probably because plink (or TortoisePlink) isn't loaded with the embedded version of HG and not activated in the local Mercurial.ini

Steps to replicate this:
- Open a repository which uses ssh
- Open the terminal
- execute 'hg pull'
fields.summary: SSH pull fails from Hg terminal without global ui.ssh configuration set

fields.description:
Hi there.

The root cause for this seems that SourceTree handles it differently. When shared folder path with backslash is entered

a) as a source path for cloning, SourceTree automatically replaces backslash with slash.
b) as a source path for a new remote, SourceTree automatically escapes backslash using backslash.

This different behavior causes all git operation with the added remote to fail, while cloing works just fine.

Is there any reason for not replacing backslash with slash when adding a remote?

Thanks.
Haruo

SourceTree for Windows 1.0.7
Embedded Git 1.8.3
Windows 7 32bit

How to reproduce:

1. Navigate through Repository - Repository setting menu - Add
2. Enter \\fileserver\myhome\myproject as source path
3. Click OK and close setting window
4. Fetch from that newly added remote

and SourceTree gives the following error:

{quote}
	git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch personal
	fatal: '\fileserver\myhome\myproject' does not appear to be a git repository	
	
	fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
	
	Please make sure you have the correct access rights
	and the repository exists.
	
	Completed with errors, see above.
{quote}

The added section of .git/config file looked like this.

{quote}
	[remote "personal"]
		url = \\\\fileserver\\myhome\\myproject
		fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/personal/*
{quote}

Workaround:

1. Enter \\\\fileserver\myhome\myproject as source path

This adds the following section to .git/config file and everything works like a charm.

{quote}
	[remote "personal"]
		url = \\\\\\\\fileserver\\myhome\\myproject
		fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/personal/*
{quote}
fields.summary: Silently convert UNC paths \\ to // for git

fields.description: When you run the installer with a DPI scaling factor set to >100% on Windows 8, the installer doesn't scale properly. This is most evident in the screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Installer doesn't look good on high DPI

fields.description:
If you have multiple heads in the same branch and wish to 'forget' about the old branch, you should be able to close the old head and keep the newest one available. 
 
When selecting the old head in this branch and close this one (right mouse click->close branch) Sourcetree closes the latest head in the branch, not the revision you want to close. 
 
Workaround: 
Using the terminal I can close it correctly by updating to the old revision and then closing that revision 
hg update -r [revisionnumber] 
hg commit --close-branch
fields.summary: Closing the oldest head in a branch, closes the newest one.

fields.description: It would be cool to have a button next to "Terminal" which allows to open the Repositoy in "Windows Explorer" as it is done in the context menu.
fields.summary: Add "Show in Explorer" Button to Toolbar

fields.description:
I have one repository open (bookmarked) and was in the search results tab. I pressed f5 right after alt-tabbing to the application and received the crash dialog. 

I also noticed another odd thing. I have sourcetree pinned to my taskbar and the shortcut was no longer usable after the crash. I had to use the shortcut in the start menu, after using that the taskbar's shortcut became 'good' again.
fields.summary: Crash when pressing f5 in search results pane

fields.description:
Replicate:

1) Open repo with large sub-repo
2) Commit changes to repo
3) Repo attempts to refresh it's history indefinitely

Workaround:

1) Restart app

Attachment:

What I see on the screen indefinitely.  It's been like this for more than 15 minutes.  If I restart the app the refresh requires only seconds.  Note, I have other repo's with sub-repo's with less history which seem to refresh more consistently.
fields.summary: Mercurial - commits to repo with large sub-repo causes indefinite repo refresh and requires app restart

fields.description: Using Source Tree normally without mercurial. Deciding to add mecurial support (embedded) using options menu. Clicking away from mecurial tab into main tab, then OK, crashes app. See log for more details.
fields.summary: Mecurial Setup via Setting crashes app

fields.description:
Using the hg-flow extension, it will always go back to the 'develop' branch. The Flow features in Sourcetree stay in the 'default' branch.sometimes depending on the order of the last merge.

Times the flow should return to 'develop':
- After initializing hg-flow (stays in 'default' at the moment)
- After finishing a release (stays in 'default' at the moment)
fields.summary: HG-Flow should go back to develop branch after finishing a command
